definition: (literary) to decline/to wane/title of a section in the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1]
surname Wei/ancient Chinese state near present day Chongqing/Taiwan pr. [Wei2]

sentences.english: This paper discusses the static model of a multi-finger micromechanical accelerometer.
sentences.chinese: 討論了一種梳齒式微機械加速度計的靜態模型。

sentences.english: After Tang and Song Dynasty, the style of landscape-painting represented by the two Lis weakened gradually.
sentences.chinese: 唐宋以降，以“二李”爲代表的青綠山水逐漸式微。

sentences.english: Nowadays, postmodernism is attenuating as an extensive surge of thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 如今作爲一種大規模的思潮它已逐漸式微。

sentences.english: But long ago, loose talk of an Olympic boycott had fizzled.
sentences.chinese: 但很久以前，抵制的說法還是逐漸式微了。

sentences.english: The provinces start to take advantage of the Empire's weakened state.
sentences.chinese: 但其他的行省開始在帝國式微之下謀取各自的利益。

sentences.english: Since then, the pro-democracy parties have fractured and their influence has waned.
sentences.chinese: 此後，親民主黨派破裂，影響力式微。

sentences.english: The low-light source of integrating sphere is the important partment of some reliability test device.
sentences.chinese: 積分球式微光源是某可靠性試驗設備的重要組元。

definition: to fall/to drop/to decline/to deteriorate/to go downhill
to rise/to spring up/to burgeon/to be aroused/to come into vogue
to be in vogue/to be prevalent
rivers pour away by the day (idiom); going from bad to worse/deteriorating day by day
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
